intro: Zuckia brandegeei var. arizonica, commonly known as Arizona zuckia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent, while its small white flowers appear in clusters. Zuckia brandegeei var. arizonica is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
